alert.note: Alert for Barry; McDonald; Newton (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 02 at 12:09PM CST by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Newton, McDonald and western Barry Counties through 100 PM CST... At 1208 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Pea Ridge to near Gravette to near Cleora. Movement was north at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Neosho, Big Sugar Creek State Park, Monett, Cassville, Seneca, Granby, Anderson, Noel, Dodge, Goodman, Purdy, South West City, Seligman, Pineville, Exeter, Loma Linda, Wheaton, Butterfield, Washburn and Lanagan. This includes Interstate 49 between mile markers 1 and 28. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
